tit.e: Katatagae (The Practice of Changing a Direction to Avoid a Tabooed Direction)

sen.j: 方違え（かたたがえ、かたちがえ）とは、陰陽道に基づいて平安時代以降に行われていた風習のひとつ。
sen.e: Katatagae was one of the customs based on Onmyodo (way of Yin and Yang; occult divination system based on the Taoist theory of the five elements) from the Heian period (794-1185).

Katatagae or Katachigae is one of the customs based on Onmyodo (way of Yin and Yang; occult divination system based on the Taoist theory of the five elements) performed from the Heian period (794-1185).
sen.cmt: 「かたたがえ、かたちがえ」→両方の読み方を入れた方が良いと思います。時制を現在形に修正しました。
sen.e: Katatagae or Katachigae is one of the customs based on Onmyodo (way of Yin and Yang; occult divination system based on the Taoist theory of the five elements) performed from the Heian period (794-1185).

sen.j: 方忌み（かたいみ）とも言う。
sen.e: It was also referred to as Kataimi.
It is also referred to as Kataimi.

sen.e: It is also referred to as Kataimi.

sen.j: 外出や造作、宮中の政、戦の開始などの際、その方角の吉凶を占い、その方角が悪いといったん別の方向に出かけ、目的地の方角が悪い方角にならないようにした。
sen.e: It was customary that people read an auspicious or inauspicious direction related to the direction in which they went out, constructed houses, administered in the imperial court, and started wars, and when they found the direction inauspicious, they relocated themselves to avoid that direction by once traveling to another place.

It was customary that people read an auspicious or inauspicious direction related to the direction in which they went out, constructed houses, administered affairs in the imperial court, and started wars, and when they found the direction inauspicious, they relocated themselves to avoid that direction by once traveling to another place.
sen.cmt: "administered"は他動詞なので、目的語を補足しました。
sen.e: It was customary that people read an auspicious or inauspicious direction related to the direction in which they went out, constructed houses, administered affairs in the imperial court, and started wars, and when they found the direction inauspicious, they relocated themselves to avoid that direction by once traveling to another place.

sen.j: 外出または帰宅の際、目的地に特定の方位神がいる場合に、いったん別の方角へ行って一夜を明かし、翌日違う方角から目的地へ向かって禁忌の方角を避けた。
sen.e: In case that when they left or came home, a specific Hoi-jin God (directional gods believed to govern people's fortune, both good and bad, descending from heaven on a certain day, travelling from one direction to another in a prescribed order, and returning to their celestial abode) presided over a certain direction in which their home was located, people stayed overnight at another site and the next day they would go home from a different direction in order to avoid the tabooed direction.
sen.cmt: 方位神→(directional gods believed to govern people's fortune, both good and bad, decending from heaven on a certain day, traveling from one direction to another in a prescribed order, and returning to their celestial abode)を補足しました
sen.e: In case that when they left or came home, a specific Hoi-jin God (directional gods believed to govern people's fortune, both good and bad, descending from heaven on a certain day, travelling from one direction to another in a prescribed order, and returning to their celestial abode) presided over the direction of their destination, people stayed overnight at another site and the next day they would go to the destination from a different direction in order to avoid the tabooed direction.
sen.cmt: 「目的地へ向かって」→目的地が自宅とは限らないので、"home"ではなく"destination"を使った方が良いと思います。
sen.e: In case that when they left or came home, a specific Hoi-jin God (directional gods believed to govern people's fortune, both good and bad, descending from heaven on a certain day, travelling from one direction to another in a prescribed order, and returning to their celestial abode) presided over the direction of their destination, people stayed overnight at another site and the next day they would go to the destination from a different direction in order to avoid the tabooed direction.

sen.j: 例えば、仕事先から西の方にある自宅へ帰ろうとしたら、西の方角に方違えの対象となる天一神が在していたとする。
sen.e: For example, just consider the case that when people came home from their office, their home was located in the west, where Tenichi-jin God, for whom people should practice Katatagae, existed.
For example, just consider the case that when people came home from their office, their home was located in the west, where Tenichi-jin God, for whom people should practice Katatagae, existed.

sen.j: この場合、真っ直に家へ帰ると天一神のいる方角を犯すことになる。
sen.e: In this case, if they came home directly, they would violate the tabooed direction, where Tenichi-jin God was located.
In this case, if they came home directly, they would violate the tabooed direction, where Tenichi-jin God was located.

sen.j: そこで、いったん他の方角、例えば南西の方角にある知人の家で一夜を明かして翌朝家に帰ることにすれば、移動は南西方向と北西方向になって、西への移動を避けることができる。
sen.e: Therefore, if they stayed overnight at their acquaintance's house located in, say, the southwest, and the next day they would come home from that place, they traveled from the southwest to the northwest, so that they were able to avoid going to the west.

Therefore, if they stayed overnight at their acquaintance's house located in, say, the southwest, and the next day they would come home from that place, they traveled to the southwest and northwest, so that they were able to avoid going to the west.
sen.cmt: 「南西方向と北西方向」→南西から北西への移動、ではなく、南西への移動と北西への移動、を意味すると思います。
sen.e: Therefore, if they stayed overnight at their acquaintance's house located in, say, the southwest, and the next day they would come home from that place, they traveled to the southwest and northwest, so that they were able to avoid going to the west.

sen.j: また、造作を行う際、その工事場所が家の中心から見て禁忌の方角に当たる場合に、いったん他所で宿泊して忌を移してから工事を行った。
sen.e: Also, in building a new house, if the construction site was located in the tabooed direction from the center of the house they lived, they stayed in another place to break the taboo before starting the construction.

Also, in building a new house, if the construction site was located in the tabooed direction from the center of the house they lived, they stayed in another place to change the direction of the site before starting the construction.
sen.cmt: 「忌を移して」→"break the taboo"だと「タブーを破る」意味になるので、「（タブーとなる）方角を変える」と修正しました。
sen.e: Also, in building a new house, if the construction site was located in the tabooed direction from the center of the house they lived, they stayed in another place to change the direction of the site before starting the construction.

sen.j: しかし、天一神のように数日で移動する方位神ならば良いが、同じ方角に1年間在する金神などが工事をしたい方角にいる場合もある。
sen.e: This practice of Katatagae for Tenichi-jin God, who remained in one direction for a few days, was easy, but there was sometimes the case where Kon-jin God presided one direction for a year, in which people planned to build a house.

This practice of Katatagae for Tenichi-jin God, who remained in one direction for a few days, was easy, but there was sometimes the case where Kon-jin God presided over one direction for a year, in which people planned to build a house.
sen.cmt: "preside"は自動詞のため目的語の前に前置詞が必要。→"presided over"に修正。
sen.e: This practice of Katatagae for Tenichi-jin God, who remained in one direction for a few days, was easy, but there was sometimes the case where Kon-jin God presided over one direction for a year, in which people planned to build a house.

sen.j: その場合には、その年の立春にいったん方違えになる方角に移動して一晩明かし、翌日自宅に戻れば当分は方違えしなくても良いとされた。
sen.e: In such case, if people stayed overnight at another place on the first day of spring in the construction year and would come home the next day, they were exempted from further practice of Katatagae for a while.

sen.e: Tenichi-jin God (also called Tenitsu-jin God, or Nagagami God) was believed to preside over a direction for five days.
Tenichi-jin God (also called Tenitsu-jin God, or Naka-gami God) was believed to preside over a direction for five days.

sen.j: 太白（たいはく）：毎日方角が変わる
sen.e: Taihaku was believed to travel from one direction to another every day.
Taihaku was believed to travel from one direction to another every day.

sen.e: Daishogun (Hoi-jin God) was believed to preside over a direction for three years, and to travel from one direction to another in five days of units.

sen.e: Each of O God and So God was believed to preside over one direction for a month and a half.

sen.e: One of the two Gods was considered to follow the other, so that a direction was presided over by the two Gods for three months in total.

sen.j: 実際の方違え

sen.j: 天一神については、5日間同じ方角が塞がるので、その方向が職場と自宅間などに該当していると不便である。
sen.e: As for Tenichi-jin God, it was inconvenient that people should practice Katatagae for five days when Tenichi-jin God was located in a direction, which lay between their home and office.
As for Tenichi-jin God, it was inconvenient that people should practice Katatagae for five days when Tenichi-jin God was located in a direction of their office or home.
sen.cmt: "direction, which lay between their home and office"部分、「職場と自宅の間に方角が位置する」という表現に違和感があります。簡潔に「職場や自宅の方角」と修正しました。
sen.e: As for Tenichi-jin God, it was inconvenient that people should practice Katatagae for five days when Tenichi-jin God was located in a direction of their office or home.

sen.j: そこで、実際には天一神がその方角へ遊行する最初の日に方違えをすれば、その方角にいる5日間は問題ないとされた。
sen.e: In fact, if people practiced Katatagae on the first day when Tenichi-jin God moved to another direction, it was considered safe for them to travel in any direction even while Tenchi-jin God stayed in the direction for five days.

In fact, if people practiced Katatagae on the first day when Tenichi-jin God moved to that direction, it was considered safe for them to travel in any direction even while Tenchi-jin God stayed in the direction for five days.
sen.cmt: 「その方角」→"another direction"から"that direction"に修正しました。
sen.e: In fact, if people practiced Katatagae on the first day when Tenichi-jin God moved to that direction, it was considered safe for them to travel in any direction even while Tenchi-jin God stayed in the direction for five days.

sen.j: 各神の遊行する日の前日の夕方に、自宅以外の方角的に問題のない場所へ移動してそこで一晩過ごし、そこが「自宅」であると方位神に対して宣言するのである。
sen.e: On the previous evening when each Hoi-jin God traveled to another direction, one declared a place which was not one's home nor located in a tabooed direction, was 'one's home' to the God and stayed there overnight.

This is the shrine where priests pray for 'protection from unlucky or taboo directions' to avoid those evil things when moving one's residence or leaving on journeys.
sen.cmt: "shrine stuff"は"staff"の間違いと思われますが、祈祷をしてくれるのは神官なので、"priest"の方が良いように思います。訳文だと、「災いが起こったときに守ってくれるよう祈る」意味に取れます。ここでは「災いが起こらないよう祈る」なので、修正しました。
sen.e: This is the shrine where priests pray for 'protection from unlucky or taboo directions' to avoid those evil things when moving one's residence or leaving on journeys.

sen.j: 人だけでなく、乗り物、自家用車についての御祓いをしてくれ、遠方からもお参りする人が絶えない。
sen.e: They pray not only for persons, but also vehicles for public and private use for safety driving, so that many people constantly visit to this shrine from a distance.
They pray not only for persons, but also vehicles and private cars, so that many people constantly visit to this shrine from a distance.
sen.cmt: 「乗り物、自家用車」→公共の乗り物、とまでは限定していないので（法人所有など、自家用車以外の乗り物、という程度だと思います）、単に"vehicles and private cars"で良いと思います。
sen.e: They pray not only for persons, but also vehicles and private cars, so that many people constantly visit to this shrine from a distance.
